intro: Cullen patens, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense, velvety pubescence. It produces showy, yellow flowers that are often followed by triangular, woody capsules containing numerous seeds. Cullen patens is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in certain regions.
